question_text: A technician is upgrading memory on a high-end business laptop. What two upgrade-related risks should they evaluate in advance?
answer_options: Incompatible power connector on the motherboard
RAM slot accessibility under casing or keyboard
Mismatched SODIMM voltage and speed ratings
correct_answer: RAM slot accessibility under casing or keyboard
explanation: Technicians must confirm that upgrades are physically possible and not restricted by soldered RAM or hard-to-reach slots.
